body:
Full stacktrace is:

```
    Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: No container runtime was found. Make sure you have either Docker or Podman installed in your environment.
    	at io.quarkus.deployment.util.ContainerRuntimeUtil.detectContainerRuntime(ContainerRuntimeUtil.java:76)
    	at io.quarkus.deployment.util.ContainerRuntimeUtil.detectContainerRuntime(ContainerRuntimeUtil.java:61)
    	at io.quarkus.deployment.util.ContainerRuntimeUtil.detectContainerRuntime(ContainerRuntimeUtil.java:48)
    	at io.quarkus.deployment.util.ContainerRuntimeUtil.detectContainerRuntime(ContainerRuntimeUtil.java:40)
    	at io.quarkus.devservices.deployment.compose.ComposeDevServicesProcessor.getComposeExecutable(ComposeDevServicesProcessor.java:312)
    	at io.quarkus.devservices.deployment.compose.ComposeDevServicesProcessor.startCompose(ComposeDevServicesProcessor.java:216)
    	at io.quarkus.devservices.deployment.compose.ComposeDevServicesProcessor.config(ComposeDevServicesProcessor.java:122)
    	at java.base/java.lang.invoke.MethodHandle.invokeWithArguments(MethodHandle.java:733)
    	at io.quarkus.deployment.ExtensionLoader$3.execute(ExtensionLoader.java:874)
    	at io.quarkus.builder.BuildContext.run(BuildContext.java:255)
    	at org.jboss.threads.ContextHandler$1.runWith(ContextHandler.java:18)
    	at org.jboss.threads.EnhancedQueueExecutor$Task.doRunWith(EnhancedQueueExecutor.java:2651)
    	at org.jboss.threads.EnhancedQueueExecutor$Task.run(EnhancedQueueExecutor.java:2630)
    	at org.jboss.threads.EnhancedQueueExecutor.runThreadBody(EnhancedQueueExecutor.java:1622)
    	at org.jboss.threads.EnhancedQueueExecutor$ThreadBody.run(EnhancedQueueExecutor.java:1589)
    	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1583)
    	at org.jboss.threads.JBossThread.run(JBossThread.java:501)
```

I understand this is a lot of work to debug, if there's anything I can do to help with this please let me know. I"m just opening it now because I'm lacking a bit of knowledge on how Quarkus does Docker runtime detection, and the code around it is quite involved

This is the place where the exception is thrown: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/1b6e3639cbc09fbeb7f5df9561927542b441f13e/core/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/deployment/util/ContainerRuntimeUtil.java#L76

Can you try to run with `quarkus.log.category."io.quarkus.deployment.util".level=DEBUG`?

It might come up with some interesting information.

That was a great tip, I think I found the issue.
Here is the CI job with debug: https://gitlab.com/rug-digitallab/products/themis/themis-core/-/jobs/11898832911

And here is the debug log that explains the issue:
```
    2025-10-29 17:24:53,204 DEBUG [io.qua.dep.uti.ContainerRuntimeUtil] (build-7) Failure to read version output from docker: io.smallrye.common.process.PipelineExecutionException: Failed to start process pipeline
    	at io.smallrye.common.process.ProcessRunner.initialize(ProcessRunner.java:127)
    	at io.smallrye.common.process.ProcessRunner.run(ProcessRunner.java:88)
    	at io.smallrye.common.process.ProcessBuilderImpl.run(ProcessBuilderImpl.java:199)
    	at io.smallrye.common.process.ProcessBuilderImpl$ViewImpl.run(ProcessBuilderImpl.java:268)
    	at io.quarkus.deployment.util.ContainerRuntimeUtil.getVersionOutputFor(ContainerRuntimeUtil.java:225)
    	at io.quarkus.deployment.util.ContainerRuntimeUtil.getContainerRuntimeEnvironment(ContainerRuntimeUtil.java:121)
    	at io.quarkus.deployment.util.ContainerRuntimeUtil.detectContainerRuntime(ContainerRuntimeUtil.java:71)
    	at io.quarkus.deployment.util.ContainerRuntimeUtil.detectContainerRuntime(ContainerRuntimeUtil.java:61)
    	at io.quarkus.deployment.util.ContainerRuntimeUtil.detectContainerRuntime(ContainerRuntimeUtil.java:48)
    	at io.quarkus.deployment.util.ContainerRuntimeUtil.detectContainerRuntime(ContainerRuntimeUtil.java:40)
    	at io.quarkus.devservices.deployment.compose.ComposeDevServicesProcessor.getComposeExecutable(ComposeDevServicesProcessor.java:312)
    	at io.quarkus.devservices.deployment.compose.ComposeDevServicesProcessor.startCompose(ComposeDevServicesProcessor.java:216)
    	at io.quarkus.devservices.deployment.compose.ComposeDevServicesProcessor.config(ComposeDevServicesProcessor.java:122)
    	at java.base/java.lang.invoke.MethodHandle.invokeWithArguments(MethodHandle.java:733)
    	at io.quarkus.deployment.ExtensionLoader$3.execute(ExtensionLoader.java:874)
    	at io.quarkus.builder.BuildContext.run(BuildContext.java:255)
    	at org.jboss.threads.ContextHandler$1.runWith(ContextHandler.java:18)
    	at org.jboss.threads.EnhancedQueueExecutor$Task.doRunWith(EnhancedQueueExecutor.java:2651)
    	at org.jboss.threads.EnhancedQueueExecutor$Task.run(EnhancedQueueExecutor.java:2630)
    	at org.jboss.threads.EnhancedQueueExecutor.runThreadBody(EnhancedQueueExecutor.java:1622)
    	at org.jboss.threads.EnhancedQueueExecutor$ThreadBody.run(EnhancedQueueExecutor.java:1589)
    	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1583)
    	at org.jboss.threads.JBossThread.run(JBossThread.java:501)
    Caused by: java.io.IOException: Cannot run program "docker": error=2, No such file or directory
    	at java.base/java.lang.ProcessBuilder.start(ProcessBuilder.java:1170)
    	at java.base/java.lang.ProcessBuilder.startPipeline(ProcessBuilder.java:1331)
    	at io.smallrye.common.process.PipelineRunner.startProcesses(PipelineRunner.java:617)
    	at io.smallrye.common.process.ProcessRunner.initialize(ProcessRunner.java:119)
    	... 22 more
    Caused by: java.io.IOException: error=2, No such file or directory
    	at java.base/java.lang.ProcessImpl.forkAndExec(Native Method)
    	at java.base/java.lang.ProcessImpl.<init>(ProcessImpl.java:295)
    	at java.base/java.lang.ProcessImpl.start(ProcessImpl.java:225)
    	at java.base/java.lang.ProcessBuilder.start(ProcessBuilder.java:1126)
    	... 25 more
```

So yeah it expects the docker binary to be present, where in our CI we have an accessible docker daemon, but the binary isn't installed (since all docker calls are just from within the JVM).
Also extra note on this, why is this a DEBUG log and not an ERROR/WARN log? I would expect such a failure to be printed without having to be in DEBUG mode right?

In theory this makes sense, since docker compose is I think just a CLI plugin client-side right? So it wouldn't be in docker-java or some other JVM docker client, which makes sense why Quarkus would depend on the docker CLI being present.

It would be much better if this was all done from the JVM without needing a docker CLI dependency on the host, but I don't know if there is a docker compose JVM client like there is docker-java for normal docker calls?

If there is not, maybe it would make sense to at least:
1. Document the need for both a docker daemon (obvious) and a docker CLI (less obvious) being present on the host
2. This log should be made a level warn/error log?
3. Make the eventual failure be a "No docker binary present" rather than a "No docker runtime found"

issue.title: Improve Docker and Podman CLI detection and error messages

body:
It's not a warning because we detect several of them (Docker/Podman, and variants of them) so it would be a bit unpractical to warn for all of them.

I created https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/50771 to improve the experience in this area, could you have a look and confirm it addresses your concerns?
I merged the PR but feedback welcome anyway :).
Thank you! I am at a conference so can't check now, but will have a look as soon as I'm back in the office

I had a look at the container and those changes look perfect to me! The combination of changing `runtime` to `CLI` and adding it to the compose docs is exactly what I think will prevent this confusion. Thanks.
Thanks for your confirmation and thanks for raising the issue!
